summary: This bill, the Health Equity and Access under the Law for Immigrant Families Act of 2025, aims to expand health insurance coverage to immigrants and their families. It removes legal barriers to health coverage for lawfully present individuals, including those with deferred action, and eliminates state restrictions on Medicaid eligibility for lawful permanent residents. The bill also addresses eligibility for individuals with Federally authorized presence regarding ACA subsidies, and removes citizenship and immigration barriers to access affordable healthcare. It further provides states with the option to extend Medicaid and CHIP to individuals without lawful presence.
